intro: Hieracium stenanthelum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and woodland edges, preferring well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are narrow and hairy, with bright yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Hieracium stenanthelum is often found in disturbed habitats and can spread readily through its rhizomes.
